provenance: Abby Weed Grey, St. Paul; Estate of Mrs. Abby Weed Grey; given to MIA, 1983.
signed: LR in ink and pencil: Maybelle Stamper 1955
text: A prolific printmaker and tireless experimenter with form, Maybelle Stamper studied in Boston and New York but spent most of her life in Captiva Island off the coast of Florida. The sea and marine life were omnipresent inspirations. Stamper made work that incorporated layers and a range of techniques, as seen in this image of a fish floating above the sea.
title: Untitled [orange fish]
